_header: If excellent of wit of grace of good virtue
Note: Formerly included under 6322; for another elegy to Frederick which follows this, see 1444.
_description: Epitaph of the Emperor Frederick, in Part VII of Fabyan’s Chronicle, translating a Latin couplet that precedes it, Septima Pars, Henrici Tercii — one stanza rhyme royal

HarEng766.First Lines:
Iff execelent of wytt or grace of good vertueOr nobylnesse of birth
                    myght vnto deth resistThan shuld this ffrederik Mortall ffate
                    excheweWhich hym hath Closid here nowln his chist…
HarEng766.Last Lines:
…But noon of thise may Erthly Man assistTo stryue with deth
                    but all must pay hym dettNoble & Ignoble ther is no thyng may
                    lett
